title: 2 bedroom house for rent
description: A handsome, partially stucco-fronted Georgian townhouse set on one of the area's most sought-after streets, arranged over three and a half floors and extending to nearly 1,300 sq ft. The house offers two bedrooms, two reception rooms, two bathrooms and a cinema room. Externally, it presents beautifully, with wrought-iron railings, climbing greenery, decorative tiling and a sage-painted period front door. <PARA> The raised ground floor opens into a notably wide hallway, finished in striking Zuber wallpaper. From here, glazed and bevelled-panel double doors lead through to the reception room, where sash windows with original shutter boxes frame the space. A Jamb London gas fireplace sits beneath elegant cornicing, while hand-finished burnt oak flooring with underfloor heating runs throughout, lending both warmth and character. <PARA> To the rear, the partially open-plan kitchen has been thoughtfully designed by Plain English and is fitted with Miele appliances, including a teppanyaki plate, alongside Quooker taps. A skylight and glazed garden door draw in generous natural light, creating a bright and inviting space for everyday living and entertaining. <PARA> The garden, designed by award-winning landscaper Jon Uglow, is a tranquil retreat. Reclaimed York stone, an intricate pebble design, a sculptural cartouche fountain, raised planting and bespoke oak seating combine to create a remarkably private oasis in the heart of London. <PARA> The first floor is dedicated to the principal suite, with high ceilings, ornate cornicing and twin sash windows overlooking the street. John Cullen lighting frames the bed, while double mahogany doors lead through to a Jeffrey James dressing room and a beautifully appointed en-suite bathroom with underfloor heating. <PARA> Above, the second floor accommodates a charming study with access onto a roof terrace offering far-reaching views across London. <PARA> The lower ground floor is arranged as a generous entertaining and guest level, comprising a cinema room lined in velvet, a wine cellar finished with mosaic tiling, and a cloakroom with Vola fittings and marble flooring. A further guest bedroom sits on this level, complete with a Jeffrey James walk-in wardrobe and an indulgent en-suite featuring a glass ceiling, Japanese soaking tub, Jacobsen shower and Arabescato marble finishes. Double doors open directly onto the north-west-facing garden. <PARA> There is potential to add an additional storey, subject to the usual consents, and the property is offered to the market chain-free. Having been featured in House & Garden, this is a beautifully considered home in a prime central London setting. <PARA> Walton Street is a charming and well-connected address, positioned between Chelsea and Knightsbridge and lined with handsome Georgian architecture and independent boutiques. The Natural History Museum and Harrods are within easy walking distance, while excellent transport links are available from South Kensington and Sloane Square. The area is also well served by highly regarded schools including Francis Holland, Garden House, Sussex House, Hill House, The Knightsbridge School and More House.
